org.cloudifysource.esc.byon
Class ByonDeployer

java.lang.Object
  org.cloudifysource.esc.byon.ByonDeployer

public class ByonDeployer
extends Object

Since:
2.0.1 Implements a cloud-simulator, using private machines as a pool of nodes on which the application is deployed. The list of available nodes and matching credentials are configured through the cloud Groovy file.
Author:
noak

Method Detail

addNodesList

public void addNodesList(String templateName,
                         List<Map<String,String>> nodesList)
                  throws Exception
Adds a list of nodes related to a specific template.

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the template this nodes-list belongs to
nodesList - A list of maps, each map representing a cloud node
Throws:
Exception - Indicates the node parsing failed

createServer

public CustomNode createServer(String templateName,
                               String serverName)
                        throws CloudProvisioningException
Creates a server (AKA a machine or a node) with the assigned logical name. The server is taken from the list of free nodes, unless this list is exhausted. If all there are no free nodes available, the invalid nodes are checked for SSH connection, and if a connection can be established - the node is used.

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the nodes-list' template this server belongs to
serverName - A logical name used to uniquely identify this node (does not have to match the host name)
Returns:
A node available for use
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicated a new machine could not be allocated, either because the name is empty or because the nodes pool is exhausted

setAllocated

public void setAllocated(String templateName,
                         Set<String> ipAddresses)
                  throws CloudProvisioningException
Sets the servers with the specified IPs as allocated, so they would not be re-allocated on future calls.

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the nodes-list' template the IPs belongs to
ipAddresses - A set of IP addresses (decimal dotted format)
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates the IPs could not be marked as allocated with the specified template

shutdownServer

public void shutdownServer(String templateName,
                           CustomNode serverName)
                    throws CloudProvisioningException
Shuts down a given node, (moves the node back to the free nodes list, to be used again).

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the nodes-list' template this server belongs to
serverName - A server to shutdown
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates the server could not be shutdown with the specified template

shutdownServerById

public void shutdownServerById(String templateName,
                               String serverId)
                        throws CloudProvisioningException
Shuts down the server with the given ID.

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the nodes-list' template this server belongs to
serverId - The ID of the server to shutdown
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates the server could not be shutdown with the specified template

shutdownServerByIp

public void shutdownServerByIp(String templateName,
                               String serverIp)
                        throws CloudProvisioningException
Shuts down the server with the given IP address.

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the nodes-list' template this server belongs to
serverIp - The IP of the server to shutdown (dotted decimal format)
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates the server could not be shutdown with the specified template

getServerByName

public CustomNode getServerByName(String templateName,
                                  String serverName)
                           throws CloudProvisioningException
Retrieves the server with the given name (not a host name).

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the nodes-list' template this server belongs to
serverName - The name of the server to retrieve
Returns:
A node matching the given name, if found
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates the server could not be obtained with the specified template

                         throws CloudProvisioningException

Parameters:

ipAddress - The IP address of the server to retrieve

A node with the given IP, if found

getAllNodesByTemplateName

public Set<CustomNode> getAllNodesByTemplateName(String templateName)
                                          throws CloudProvisioningException
Retrieves all nodes (i.e. in all states - free, allocated and invalid).

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the nodes-list' template to use
Returns:
A collection of all the managed nodes of the specified template
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates the servers list could not be obtained for the given template name

                                           throws CloudProvisioningException

Parameters:

Returns:
A collection of all the free nodes of the specified template

public Set<CustomNode> getAllocatedNodesByTemplateName(String templateName)
                                                throws CloudProvisioningException
Retrieves all allocated nodes.

Parameters:
templateName - The name of the nodes-list' template to use
Returns:
A collection of all the allocated (active, in use) nodes of the specified template
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates the servers list could not be obtained for the given template name

                                              throws CloudProvisioningException

Returns:

invalidateServer

public void invalidateServer(String templateName,
                             CustomNode serverName)
                      throws CloudProvisioningException
* Invalidates the given node (i.e. moves it from the free pool to the invalidated pool), so it will not be allocated unless all the free nodes are in use.

Parameters:
templateName - The template this server belongs to
serverName - The name of the server to invalidate
Throws:
CloudProvisioningException - Indicates the server could not be marked as Invalid for the specified template

close

public void close()
closes the deployer, currently not doing anything.
